summary: Paul Merson reignited his dispute with Andros Townsend following the Tottenham midfielder's late substitution in the team's 0-0 draw with Burnley, where Townsend was brought on in the 83rd minute. Merson had previously criticized Townsend's inclusion in the England squad in his Sky Sports column, stating that if Townsend could make the team, it suggested anyone could. However, Merson was proven wrong when Townsend scored a spectacular goal for England against Italy, leading Merson to acknowledge his error and praise Townsend's performance. Despite this, Merson couldn't resist taking another jab at Townsend after the Burnley match, questioning his late entry into the game via Twitter. Townsend had previously responded to Merson's initial criticism with a tweet after scoring against Italy, challenging Merson's assertion that he shouldn't be in the squad. Despite an apparent resolution of their differences, Merson's recent comment indicates that the tension between them has not fully subsided.

Chelsea have made a formal offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto, as confirmed by FC Tokyo's president Naoki Ogane. Muto, who has scored 16 goals in 37 appearances for his current club and has 11 international caps with one goal for Japan, is set to join Chelsea and then be loaned to Vitesse Arnhem for the next season if the transfer is completed. The offer from Chelsea is stated to be unrelated to their recent £200million sponsorship deal with Japanese company Yokohama Rubber. Muto, a recent economics graduate from Keio University, is honored by Chelsea's interest but has not yet decided on the move. The proposed transfer fee is rumored to be around £4million. Muto's achievements include being named in the J-League's best XI after scoring 13 goals in his debut season, and he has continued his scoring form in the current season with three goals in four games, helping FC Tokyo to third place in the division. Additionally, Chelsea is considering a pre-season tour of Japan, coinciding with Yokohama Rubber becoming their official shirt sponsor starting from the 2015-16 season.

A large-scale study has discovered that infants who receive antibiotics during their first six months of life are more likely to be overweight by the age of two. The study, published in the journal Pediatrics, involved over 12,000 healthy two-year-olds and found that one in five boys and one in ten girls were overweight or obese. The research indicated that children, especially boys, who were prescribed antibiotics as babies had a higher chance of being overweight and were also slightly taller. The study suggested a potential link between antibiotic use and weight gain, possibly due to the drugs altering the gut microbiota, which could affect food digestion and appetite. Lead author Dr. Antti Saari emphasized the need for judicious use of antibiotics in infancy, as their overuse might contribute to the global childhood obesity epidemic. The findings add to existing concerns about the over-prescription of antibiotics, which includes the risk of antibiotic resistance and the potential for common infections to become more difficult to treat.

A Buckingham Palace guard accidentally slipped and fell on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard ceremony, an event witnessed by hundreds of tourists and captured on camera by holidaymaker David Meadwell. The guard, wearing full regalia, lost his footing, slid sideways, knocked his bearskin hat against the sentry box, and dropped his rifle. The incident occurred as the soldier attempted to march away, and it is believed that the metal protectors on his boots contributed to the slip. Despite the fall, the guard quickly got up and continued as if nothing had happened, though he was visibly embarrassed by the incident. The Changing of the Guard is a popular tourist attraction that takes place daily in the summer and every other day in the winter, involving fully operational soldiers who are part of The Queen's Guard. The Ministry of Defence declined to comment on the matter.

The iconic miniseries "Roots," which captivated over 100 million viewers in 1977 with its story of an African-American slave and his descendants, is being remade by A&E networks to air in 2016. The remake will be a contemporary take on Alex Haley's novel "Roots: The Saga of an American Family" and will be simulcast on A&E, Lifetime, and History. LeVar Burton, the original Kunta Kinte, will serve as co-executive producer. The new version aims for added authenticity by consulting scholars in African and African-American history. The project is seen as an opportunity to introduce the powerful tale to a new generation, in a time marked by significant racial events and the presidency of Barack Obama. The producers aim to honor the legacy of the original series and the enduring spirit of Kunta Kinte, with Mark Wolper, son of the original producer, emphasizing the importance of continuing to tell Kinte's story.

A former royal footman, Christopher Lawler, has accused palace aides of attempting to coerce him into an orgy at Clarence House in January 1978. On his first day of work, Lawler was allegedly groped by a male staff member, which led to him leaving his job in tears. The incident, which occurred at the Queen Mother's London residence, involved Lawler being pinned to a chair and sexually harassed by several men, including a senior member of staff. Despite reporting the incident on the same day, Lawler claims his complaints were ignored by Clarence House officials for months.

Lawler, now 64, decided to contact palace officials again last year after inquiries into alleged cover-ups of child sex abuse by a VIP paedophile ring in the 1970s and 80s came to light. His case was eventually passed to Scotland Yard, and a retired royal aide in his 80s was interviewed but denied involvement, claiming he was working for the Queen in Balmoral at the time of the alleged incident. The Royal Household has stated it will fully cooperate with any police investigation. The police have declined to comment on the ongoing investigation.

A couple from Happy Valley, Oregon, Jesse and Melissa Meek, creatively announced their pregnancy through a rap video set to the theme of the '90s sitcom 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.' The video, which has garnered over 1.7 million views on YouTube, shows the couple rapping about their journey to parenthood while driving in a car. Melissa's rap discusses the pressure they felt from family to have children and the surprise of conceiving quickly, while Jesse raps about their initial expectation of a longer conception process. The video concludes with them sharing a sonogram of their upcoming child. The Meeks made the video to share the news with distant family and friends and were surprised by its viral success. They have suggested that another video might be made after discovering the baby's gender. Jesse is a descendant of Oregon pioneer Joseph Lafayette Meek. Previously, Melissa had also made a video capturing Jesse's reaction to the pregnancy news. Another couple from Phoenixville, Pennsylvania, had similarly used the 'Fresh Prince' theme for their pregnancy announcement the previous year.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in the 1939 film "Gone With the Wind" was sold at auction for $137,000. The gray jacket and skirt, originally slate blue-gray but faded over time, were featured in key scenes with Clark Gable's Rhett Butler and in a shanty town attack scene. The auction, held by Heritage Auctions in Beverly Hills, included over 150 items from the film. The dress was part of a vast collection belonging to James Tumblin, a former Universal Studios hair and makeup department head, who began collecting memorabilia from the film in the 1960s. Tumblin rescued the dress from being discarded at the Western Costume Company for $20. The auction also featured other high-selling items related to the film, such as a straw hat worn by Leigh for $52,500, a suit worn by Gable for $55,000, and a black bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia De Havilland for $30,000. "Gone With The Wind," based on Margaret Mitchell's novel, celebrated its 75th anniversary recently and is notable for Hattie McDaniel's historic Academy Award win, making her the first African-American actor to receive the honor.

A two-year-old boy fell into the cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after being dangled over the railing by his parents. The incident occurred when the child's mother, who was holding him and another child, lost her grip, and the toddler fell 10 to 12 feet into the enclosure. The boy's parents managed to rescue him before emergency services arrived. He was treated for minor injuries, including bumps and bruises, and a leg injury, but was not harmed by the cheetahs, which did not approach him. Witnesses expressed shock at the incident and questioned how the parents could have let the child fall. The zoo's executive director, Dr. Christopher Kuhar, confirmed that the zoo had multiple eyewitness accounts suggesting the child was dangled over the railing. As a result, the zoo intends to press child endangerment charges against the family. The cheetah exhibit was closed following the incident.

A speed camera previously used to enforce a 30mph speed limit on a residential road in Handsworth, Birmingham, has been found repositioned to face the front door of a nearby house. This camera, along with approximately 300 other speed and traffic cameras in the West Midlands, has been non-operational since March 2013 due to outdated technology. The deactivated cameras have been replaced by mobile camera units, motorway cameras, and traffic officer patrols. The Birmingham City Council has been made aware of the camera's new position and plans to send an engineer to assess the situation, with the possibility of removing the camera entirely. The council spokesperson confirmed that fixed location safety cameras have been decommissioned since 2013 and that there are plans for a pilot program using new digital technology at a limited number of sites, but the camera in question will not be part of this pilot. The homeowners could not be reached for comment.

1. Usain Bolt, a six-time Olympic gold medalist, will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas, scheduled for May 2 and 3.
2. Bolt will be part of the Jamaican team and has expressed his excitement and readiness to participate, stating he is both fit and healthy.
3. Bolt has heard positive feedback about the previous year's event and is looking forward to contributing to Jamaica's strong relay tradition.
4. Garth Gayle, the General Secretary of the Jamaica Athletics Administrative Association (JAAA), expressed pleasure at Bolt's availability and anticipates impressive performances from him at the event.
5. The full team list for Jamaica's participation in the competition will be released soon.
6. Bolt emphasizes his commitment to making Jamaica proud whenever he competes for his country.

1. Neymar and Dani Alves, teammates at FC Barcelona, showed their loyalty to the club by attending the basketball El Clasico between Barcelona and Real Madrid. They were accompanied by Neymar's sister, Rafaella.
2. Barcelona won the Euro League basketball match against Real Madrid with a score of 85-80.
3. Despite the victory, Real Madrid still leads the Euro League division over Barcelona by points difference.
4. Neymar, who captained Brazil, was involved in a tough match against Chile, which Brazil won 1-0 at the Emirates Stadium. He faced several aggressive challenges during the game.
5. Prior to the international break, Barcelona, managed by Luis Enrique, had won their El Clasico match in La Liga, extending their lead at the top to four points.
6. Neymar and his Barcelona teammates are set to resume their La Liga campaign against Celta Vigo, as they aim for a treble of trophies.
7. The passage includes several images of Neymar, his sister Rafaella, and Dani Alves at the basketball game, as well as a mention of an incident where Chile's Gary Medel appeared to stamp on Neymar during the international match.

A total of 8,480 migrants were rescued from Friday to Monday as they attempted to reach Europe from Africa and the Middle East, with the Italian coast guard receiving SOS calls from 20 distressed boats on Monday alone. There are fears that 400 migrants may be missing after survivors reported that their ship, which was carrying 550 people, capsized about 80 miles off the Libyan coast. However, the Italian coast guard has not confirmed this incident and has found no evidence of such a capsizing, despite conducting search operations.

The number of migrant boats crossing the Mediterranean into Italy has surged recently, with the Italian Coast Guard performing an increasing number of rescues. The International Organization for Migration reports that Italy registered over 10,000 migrant arrivals in the first three months of 2015 and rescued about 2,000 at sea during the first weekend of April in the Channel of Sicily. The majority of migrants this year are from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, using Libya as a transit country.

Since the beginning of the year, at least 480 migrants have died while attempting to cross the Mediterranean, often due to poor weather conditions and overcrowded vessels. Smugglers sometimes abandon the ships, leaving passengers to their fate. In a single day last week, 978 migrants were rescued in the Mediterranean Sea.

Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is pleased that Chilean forward Alexis Sanchez chose to join Arsenal instead of Liverpool, although he is unsure of the exact reasons behind Sanchez's decision. Sanchez, who was also pursued by other top clubs, has made a significant impact at Arsenal since his arrival, scoring 19 goals this season. Wenger acknowledges that Liverpool's interest in Sanchez might have been related to their negotiations with Barcelona over Luis Suarez's transfer. The Arsenal boss praises Sanchez for his high-quality performances, including his ability to energize the team and fans. Ahead of a crucial Premier League match against Liverpool, Wenger dismisses rumors of Arsenal's interest in Liverpool's Raheem Sterling, who has declined a new contract. Despite Liverpool's recent setbacks, Wenger commends Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers for his team's development following the departure of Suarez and the injury of striker Daniel Sturridge.

Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion and the 2012 Tour de France winner, will attempt to break the cycling hour record on June 7 at the Lee Valley VeloPark's Olympic Velodrome in London. The 35-year-old, who has a strong track cycling background with three Olympic gold medals, will aim to cycle the furthest distance within an hour, a challenge he describes as a "holy grail" in cycling history. Wiggins, who finished his Team Sky career at the Paris-Roubaix, is expected to set a significant record. He will prepare for the Hour record attempt after participating in the Tour de Yorkshire with his own team, and he aims to motivate others to challenge themselves as he does.

The current hour record of 52.491km was set by Australian Rohan Dennis in February, following the UCI's regulation changes that sparked renewed interest in the event. Previous attempts saw German Jens Voigt set a record in September, which was then surpassed by Austria's Matthias Brandle, while Jack Bobridge's attempt fell short. Another British cyclist, Alex Dowsett, is also set to challenge Dennis' record on May 2 in Manchester.

Wiggins' attempt at the Hour record will be in front of a capacity crowd of 6,000, with tickets going on sale from April 19, and the event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports. Wiggins is targeting a British record eighth Olympic medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics, aiming for success in the team pursuit event.

1. Serena Williams, a two-time French Open champion, described her challenging victory over Sara Errani in the Fed Cup as an 'eye-opener' for the upcoming claycourt season. Despite winning 4-6 7-6(3) 6-3, Williams was critical of her performance and acknowledged her lack of readiness for clay courts.

2. The match against Errani, which Williams eventually won, took her career record against the Italian to 8-0. However, the American team, including Williams and Alison Riske, suffered a 6-0 6-3 loss in the doubles rubber to Errani and Flavia Pennetta, resulting in the US being relegated to World Group II.

3. The Fed Cup play-off match was played under tough weather conditions, affecting both players' performances. Errani put up a strong fight, but Williams' power ultimately secured her the win.

4. Williams reflected on the need to adapt her game to the clay surface, emphasizing the necessity of being prepared to engage in long rallies.

5. Williams, who won her 19th singles grand slam at the Australian Open, is considered a contender for all majors this year, although the French Open has historically been her least successful.

6. The doubles defeat marked the first blemish on Williams' previously perfect Fed Cup record. The US team now faces the challenge of returning to the elite World Group next year.

7. US captain Mary Joe Fernandez expressed determination for the team to work harder and improve, highlighting the depth of American players in the top 100 as a positive factor for future success in the Fed Cup.

1. River Plate is interested in signing Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao.
2. Falcao previously played for River Plate for eight years before transferring to Porto in 2009.
3. The vice president of River Plate, Matias Patanian, expressed the club's desire to have Falcao return, stating, "We dream of Falcao Garcia. The doors are open."
4. Falcao, who is currently on loan at Manchester United, has had a challenging season with only four Premier League goals.
5. Despite his struggles at Manchester United, Falcao has performed well for Colombia, scoring three goals in two recent matches and equaling the country's all-time goalscoring record with 24 goals.
6. Falcao's history with River Plate includes joining the club at age 15, making his first-team debut at 19, and scoring 34 goals in 90 appearances during his tenure in the first team.

2012's X Factor finalist Ella Henderson has been named the face of Batiste's 2015 'Ready For It' campaign. The 19-year-old pop star, known for her impressive vocals, is featured in the campaign with various hairstyles against a vibrant city backdrop. Henderson is shown with wavy hair and in a tousled half-ponytail, wearing fashionable attire that includes a black fringed leather jacket and a black animal-print sheer panel maxi dress. This marks her first brand collaboration, facilitated by the MILES agency. The campaign, which includes a TV advertisement featuring Henderson's song "Mirror Man," was launched internationally. Henderson expressed enthusiasm about the partnership, noting that she is a regular user of Batiste's dry shampoo. The CEO of Crown Talent & Media Group, which manages Ella, highlighted the synergy between the artist and the UK's leading dry shampoo brand, anticipating an exciting year ahead.

1. Aaron Siler, 26, was fatally shot by officer Pablo Torres in Kenosha, Wisconsin, on March 14 after allegedly arming himself during a confrontation.
2. Torres is on leave as the shooting is investigated.
3. A billboard featuring Torres and his dog, with the message "Thank you for your support, Kenosha," was erected by the Kenosha Professional Police Association, which has sparked shock and outrage among Siler's family and friends.
4. They find the billboard disrespectful and are calling for its removal, with family friend Kathy Willie expressing that it feels like a thank you for killing Siler.
5. The police association stated the billboard was not meant to offend but to express gratitude for community support during a difficult time for the officer and the department.
6. Siler was shot after a vehicle and foot chase, as he was wanted on a felony probation and parole warrant.
7. This incident followed another shooting involving Torres ten days prior, where Terry Knight, 66, was shot and wounded; Knight was charged with second-degree recklessly endangering safety.
8. The state Division of Criminal Investigation is investigating both shootings, with the District Attorney having already determined the shooting of Knight was justified. The investigation into Siler's death is ongoing.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants in the southeastern town of Negur, near the border with Pakistan. The militant group Jaish al Adl claimed responsibility for the attack. The group, which is anti-Iranian and targets Shiites to counter Iranian influence in Pakistan, has previously carried out attacks on Iranian territory, including a deadly assault in 2013 that killed 14 border guards. Following the incident, Iran has urged Pakistan to capture the surviving attackers. Pakistan's government has condemned the attack and promised to investigate and apprehend the militants if they are found to have entered Pakistani territory. Iran has criticized Pakistan in the past for not doing enough to prevent such cross-border attacks.

1. The video game "Space Invaders," created in late 1970s Japan, has a real-life counterpart in contemporary political discussions in Japan.
2. Japan's Defense Minister Gen Nakatani stated in the Diet (Japan's parliament) that the country's Air Self Defense Force (ASDF) has never encountered extraterrestrial UFOs.
3. Nakatani explained that the ASDF responds to potential airspace violations by scrambling fighter jets and making visual observations, but they have only encountered birds or non-aircraft flying objects, not UFOs from other planets.
4. The query was posed by Antonio Inoki, a former wrestler and current lawmaker known for his flamboyant career, including founding the New Japan Pro Wrestling organization, fighting Muhammad Ali, and engaging in diplomatic efforts in Iraq and North Korea.
5. Inoki, who has claimed to have seen a UFO and practices both Islam and Buddhism, asked whether Japan's military had ever been mobilized against extraterrestrial threats and if there was any research into alien visitors.
6. This is not the first time UFOs and extraterrestrial threats have been discussed in Japanese politics; in 2007, then-Defense Minister Shigeru Ishiba considered the legal implications of defending against an alien invasion under Japan's pacifist constitution.

35-year-old passenger Jin Pai was hospitalized with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks after a toilet he was squatting on broke and shattered in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport. Pai was standing on the toilet rim due to concerns about cleanliness when the incident occurred. Despite initial embarrassment, he called his companions for help and was taken to a hospital where he received stitches. Initially, Pai admitted to squatting on the toilet but later claimed he was sitting when it collapsed, possibly to avoid compensation. Police confirmed the incident was an accident and reminded individuals that toilets are meant for sitting, not standing.

56-year-old Kevin Rebbie from Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested following the discovery of a hidden camera in a bathroom by a 15-year-old girl. The camera was traced back to Rebbie. He is accused of sexually abusing the girl over a four-year period, starting when she was nine years old, and filming her and others in the bathroom without their consent. Rebbie faces multiple charges, including aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children, and invasion of privacy. The investigation revealed 41 videos from the hidden camera, 34 of which showed victims showering. Rebbie admitted to filming several victims, including other juveniles, with the intention of specifically recording the 15-year-old girl. The police chief described the crimes as particularly horrific due to the violation of the victim's privacy in her own home. Rebbie's relationship to the girl's family is not disclosed. His preliminary hearing is scheduled for May 1, and he is being held on a $500,000 bail.

The passage describes a unique photography series by Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama, which features portraits of teenage daughters standing next to their fathers in mid-air. The daughters are seen smiling directly at the camera, while their fathers, dressed in sharp suits, strike dynamic and sometimes humorous poses as they leap. The series is part of Aoyama's latest book, which translates to "Daughter and Salary Man." The concept behind the images is to allow the fathers, who typically maintain a serious demeanor, to express a more playful and heroic side, filled with excitement and hope. Despite some of the older fathers showing slightly pained expressions during their jumps, the photos have garnered significant online interest due to their unusual and engaging nature. The images also serve as a backdrop to various Japanese landmarks, with the daughters dressed casually in contrast to their fathers' formal attire. The exact motivation or story behind the creation of these photos remains undisclosed.

The passage discusses the recent dismissal of Paul Downton as England's managing director and the subsequent shift in focus to the county championship season, particularly concerning Kevin Pietersen. Pietersen, who was previously axed from the England team by Downton in 2014, is seen in a range of emotions during a Surrey team photo shoot at the KIA Oval, reflecting his potential return to the England team following Downton's departure. The batsman, who last played for England during the disastrous Ashes tour in Australia, is in good spirits as he jokes with photographers and teammates, indicating a positive outlook on his chances of rejoining the international team. Pietersen's return to Surrey is part of his effort to force his way back into the Test set-up ahead of England's attempt to regain the Ashes this summer. The county championship season begins with Surrey's match against Glamorgan on April 19, and Pietersen will also play in a MCC University match against Oxford MCCU on Sunday.

1. Romanian club Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt, facing relegation, has dismissed their Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time within a week.
2. Ze Maria, a former Brazilian international with 25 caps, was initially fired due to a poor run of results but was rehired the following day after the club's owner, Angelo Massone, decided to give him another chance.
3. The decision to sack him again came after Ceahlaul's defeat to FC Botosani, which left the team 16th in the league standings and six points away from safety.
4. Ze Maria, who had a five-year international career and played for clubs like Inter Milan and Parma, had been appointed in January, replacing Florin Marin, and was the third coach for Ceahlaul this season.
5. Serbian Vanya Radinovic will be taking over as the new coach of Ceahlaul.

1. Radamel Falcao, a former Monaco player, is believed by his ex-teammate Nabil Dirar to regret his loan move to Manchester United.
2. Despite not being happy in France, Falcao's time at Manchester United has been underwhelming, with only four goals scored this season.
3. Manchester United have the option to make Falcao's transfer permanent for £46 million, but his performance has made it unlikely they will exercise this option.
4. Falcao's struggles at Manchester United are attributed to not fully recovering from a serious knee injury that affected his form.
5. Dirar suggests that Falcao might have been better off staying at Monaco, where he would have played more and participated in the Champions League.
6. Dirar also mentions that Falcao was not feeling well in Monaco, hinting at personal reasons for his desire to leave.

A man wearing a 'distinctive' cartoon mask and a fluoro orange sweatshirt robbed a dairy in Christchurch, New Zealand. The incident occurred on Saturday when the offender, described as 'very tall', demanded cash from the owner's daughter. He fled with the till and approximately $1500 in cash. The dairy's owner, Christina Chen, reported that her daughter was scared and ran out of the shop screaming after the robber threw the cash register to the ground and took the till drawer. Although no weapons were seen, the robber has not been apprehended. New Zealand police are seeking the public's assistance in identifying the man and have provided a hotline and online messaging option for anyone with information to contact them.

24-year-old Kaitlyn Granado, a math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, was arrested twice within a month for alleged inappropriate relationships with students. Initially, she was arrested on March 19 for having an improper relationship with a 15-year-old student, involving kissing and allowing the student to touch her breasts in April of the previous year. After being released on bail and suspended from teaching, a second accusation emerged.

On March 24, a second student, also 15 years old, accused Granado of having sex with him in her car on two consecutive nights in January. The allegations were substantiated by an affidavit, which detailed the encounters occurring late at night across from another school in Dallas. Despite initial beliefs that there were no other involved students, further investigation confirmed the second student's claims. Granado was arrested again and released on a $50,000 bail. The Irving school district has taken action by placing her on administrative leave, ensuring she cannot interact with students or be present on school property. The outcome of the second set of charges is yet to be determined.

1. A video showing a large crocodile swimming through a marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead dog in its jaws, has garnered over half a million views online.
2. The incident was witnessed by New Zealander Tim Weston and his wife while on holiday. Weston described the crocodile holding the dog, which belonged to a local bike shop owner, in its mouth without moving for an extended period.
3. The crocodile, with the lifeless dog wearing a red collar, was observed lurking in the marina for hours.
4. Weston noted that there is a crocodile sanctuary 200 meters away from the marina, suggesting the crocodile may have come from there.
5. The dog was likely curious and approached the water's edge, leading to the fatal encounter with the crocodile.
6. The video captures the crocodile swimming calmly through the marina, surrounded by rocks and a footpath, as onlookers watch in shock.
7. Social media reactions to the video, which was shared on the Bogged Facebook page, have been mixed, with some expressing horror and others acknowledging it as a part of nature.
8. Crocodiles are a common sight in Puerto Vallarta, a beach resort built among mangroves that have been the crocodiles' habitat for centuries.
9. The American Crocodiles in Mexico can grow up to 6 meters long and are increasingly found living close to human populations due to urbanization.
10. Despite the shocking nature of the video, it highlights the presence of crocodiles in areas where humans recreate, emphasizing the need for awareness and caution in regions where wildlife and human activities intersect.

Steve Bruce remains confident that Hull City can avoid relegation from the Barclays Premier League despite a 2-0 loss to Southampton, which leaves them just two points above the relegation zone with six games remaining. Initially aiming for 10 wins to secure survival, Hull has only achieved six victories, leading Bruce to hope that eight or nine wins might suffice. Hull played well in the first half against Southampton, but goals from James Ward-Prowse and Graziano Pelle sealed their defeat. Bruce believes his team can overcome their current predicament, citing their achievements over the past three years, including promotion, a cup final appearance, and last season's survival. However, he acknowledges that this season has been challenging due to heightened expectations and significant injuries to key players such as Michael Dawson, Nikica Jelavic, and Robert Snodgrass.

Meanwhile, Southampton's victory moved them up to fifth place in the league, surpassing Tottenham and Liverpool. Southampton's manager, Ronald Koeman, faced an internal issue as Sadio Mane attempted to take a penalty that was designated for Ward-Prowse, leading Koeman to address the breach of team rules with his squad.

1. Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, was banned from teaching after he allowed pupils to change their answers on SATs exams after the exam session had ended, and also altered some answers himself.
2. The conduct panel heard that Guffick's actions led to the annulment of all SATs results for the entire school for the year 2014.
3. Guffick admitted to the allegations, which were deemed unacceptable professional conduct, but claimed he only asked pupils to make their answers more legible, not to change them.
4. The National College for Teaching and Leadership panel found Guffick's actions to be dishonest but not fraudulent or seriously dishonest.
5. Despite expressing regret and explaining his actions, Guffick was banned from teaching for at least two years by Paul Heathcote, acting on behalf of Education Secretary Nicky Morgan.
6. The decision to ban Guffick was made because his actions had a serious impact on the school, leading to the annulment of its SATs results, and because he acted deliberately without duress.
7. Guffick was given the opportunity to appeal the decision to the High Court within 28 days.

1. Anders Lindegaard, a goalkeeper for Manchester United, has not had much playing time at the club.
2. He is married to Swedish model Misse Beqiri, with whom he has a son. They got married in a beach wedding in Mauritius and have been together since 2012.
3. Lindegaard, who joined Manchester United from Aalesunds in 2010, has made few league appearances, with only 19 in five seasons.
4. He is currently the third-choice goalkeeper at Manchester United, behind David de Gea and Victor Valdes.
5. Lindegaard has been permitted to seek a transfer by the club and was nearly signed by FC Midtjylland, but the move fell through due to disagreement over the transfer fee.
6. Despite his professional struggles, Lindegaard enjoys a happy personal life, often sharing moments with his wife on social media. His wife, Misse Beqiri, is active on Instagram, where she has over 17,000 followers and frequently posts about her modeling work and personal life.

13 glowing blue letters from the iconic Yankee Stadium signage, which were expected to sell for $300,000 to $600,000 at a Sotheby's auction, failed to attract any bids except for a non-winning bid by a Sotheby's employee. The letters, owned by Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson since 2008, were 10-feet-tall and had been part of the stadium's identity since 1976, a year before Jackson joined the team. Jackson, who is 68 years old, had hoped a new owner would enjoy this piece of New York City history. Despite the letters' lack of interest, a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 1960s, estimated at $20,000 to $30,000, sold for $112,500 at the same auction.

1. Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers has addressed the recent behavior of players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe, reminding them of their professional responsibilities following incidents involving legal high nitrous oxide and shisha pipe use.
2. Despite the incidents, Rodgers has chosen not to discipline Sterling or Ibe, preferring to use the opportunity as a learning experience and to move forward.
3. Rodgers spoke with both players in his office and emphasized the importance of their actions and public image as elite athletes.
4. Steven Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa after serving a suspension, but Rodgers did not confirm whether Gerrard would be immediately recalled to the starting lineup.
5. Rodgers is focused on leading Liverpool to their first FA Cup final under his management, viewing the team's previous near-misses in the title race and Capital One Cup as valuable learning experiences that can drive the team's success.
6. He highlighted that losing is part of the journey to becoming winners, noting that past setbacks can be instrumental in improving the team and ultimately achieving victory.

1. Mesut Ozil, Arsenal's star midfielder, relaxed at home in London with his dog after the international break, sharing a photo on Twitter with the caption "Home Sweet Home."
2. He had a successful international duty, contributing to Germany's 2-0 victory over Georgia in a Euro 2016 qualifier.
3. Ozil is now focusing on Arsenal's upcoming Premier League match against Liverpool, where he is expected to play a key role despite having missed the previous game against Newcastle due to illness.
4. There were unfounded rumors of Ozil being seen in a Berlin nightclub during his absence from the Newcastle match, which Arsenal won 2-1, but manager Arsene Wenger dismissed these.
5. Since recovering from an injury in January, Ozil has been instrumental on the field, with four assists and three goals to his name.
6. The player, who joined Arsenal for £42.5 million from Real Madrid in 2013, expressed that he is adapting well to English football, citing the frequency of matches and the lack of a winter break as factors that suit his preference for playing regularly.

1. Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu has stated that there are no intentions to replace manager Luis Enrique.
2. Luis Enrique, who took charge of Barcelona last summer on a two-year contract, is close to winning the La Liga title, with only six games remaining.
3. Despite rumors suggesting Enrique might be replaced at the end of the season, Bartomeu has expressed satisfaction with Enrique's performance.
4. Bartomeu emphasized that Enrique is focused on the current season, including La Liga and the Champions League, and praised the manager's dedication, citing his preparation for the game against Valencia following the Champions League match against PSG.
5. Barcelona is one of the few clubs still in contention for three trophies this season, highlighting Enrique's success.
6. In a recent match, Barcelona defeated Valencia with goals from Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi, showcasing the team's strength under Enrique's management.

1. Jordan Henderson, Liverpool FC's vice-captain, has agreed to a new long-term contract with the club.
2. His current contract had 14 months remaining, and negotiations for the new deal had been ongoing since the start of the season.
3. The new contract is expected to be worth around £100,000 per week and will extend his commitment to Liverpool until the summer of 2020.
4. Henderson, aged 24, is the third key player in manager Brendan Rodgers' squad to sign a contract extension, following Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho.
5. He was signed by former manager Kenny Dalglish in June 2011 for £16million from Sunderland and has significantly improved under Rodgers' management.
6. This season, Henderson has performed well, contributing 13 assists and scoring seven goals from midfield.
7. He is being considered to take over as club captain following Steven Gerrard's departure to LA Galaxy.
8. Discussions with another player, Raheem Sterling, regarding his contract are on hold until the end of the season, but Liverpool's Chief Executive, Ian Ayre, has expressed confidence that Sterling will remain at the club for the long term.
9. Liverpool is expected to see the departure of up to 10 players, and manager Brendan Rodgers is focused on securing the team's core players.
10. Sterling has previously rejected a new deal with Liverpool, but negotiations are set to continue in the summer.

1. Filipe Luis expresses his desire to remain at Chelsea until the end of his contract, despite interest from his former club Atletico Madrid in re-signing him.
2. Luis, who joined Chelsea from Atletico Madrid on a three-year contract in July, has not been a regular starter at Chelsea.
3. Atletico Madrid is considering leveraging Luis's lack of consistent playing time to bring him back.
4. Luis has stated that he is happy at Chelsea and intends to honor his contract.
5. During the international break, Luis played for Brazil in friendly matches against France and Chile.
6. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is pushing his team to maintain focus and win every remaining game in the Premier League title run-in, as relayed by Luis.
7. Luis acknowledges the difficulty of the upcoming fixtures and emphasizes the team's preparedness to handle the pressure of the title race.
8. With international duties completed, Luis's focus is now back on the Premier League as Chelsea aims to secure the title.

Nathan Hughes, a Wasps No 8, successfully appealed a three-match ban imposed for a collision with George North during a match on March 27. Initially, Hughes was deemed 'reckless' for not preventing his knee from hitting North's head as he scored a try, resulting in a red card and subsequent suspension. Despite no intent to harm, the disciplinary panel sanctioned Hughes, sparking widespread criticism and support for the player, including from high-profile figures like James Haskell, Andy Goode, Austin Healey, and Joe Marler.

The appeal, lodged by Wasps, was upheld after the appeal panel reviewed new evidence, concluding that the incident was accidental and no foul play was involved. Hughes, who missed Wasps' Champions Cup quarter-final due to the suspension, is now cleared to play immediately but will likely return to action against Exeter on April 26. George North, who was knocked unconscious and suffered his third concussion in two months, has been advised to take at least a month off from playing.

A striking sunset with a deep reddish color was observed in Washington, captured by Seattle photographer Tim Durkan. The unusual sunsets were caused by wildfires in southeastern Siberia, which began when farmers burning grass in their fields lost control of the flames due to strong winds on April 14. The fires have devastated dozens of villages in the region. Despite rescue crews extinguishing the flames, the smoke was carried across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest by atmospheric winds, affecting parts of Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia. The intense red sunsets are a result of smoke particles in the atmosphere filtering out shorter wavelength colors, allowing red and orange light to dominate the sky, especially during sunrises and sunsets when light has to pass through more atmosphere. As the smoke clears, the air quality is expected to improve, and the vivid red sunsets will fade.

A Missouri mother, Becky Schoenig from St. Louis, had her new 2015 Ford Fusion stolen from her driveway. The car was found by police following a tip from a man who recognized it. Upon its return, Schoenig discovered that the thieves had made some modifications to the vehicle, including red rims, red detailing on the sides, and orange accents on the steering wheel. Instead of being upset, Schoenig humorously expressed her gratitude on Facebook for the unexpected makeover, joking that her car was now 'pimpin.' Despite the humor, she is having the car cleaned to remove the odors of cigarettes and marijuana left by the thieves. Additionally, Schoenig is honoring the man who helped recover her car, Mick Sexton, by creating a new smoothie named after him at her restaurant, The Hot Pot. Her friend, Marlene Trice, described Schoenig as a vibrant and humorous person who enjoys making others laugh.

1. Manchester City players stand to lose a £500,000 bonus each if they do not qualify for the Champions League this season.
2. The club has incentivised contracts for players like Sergio Aguero, David Silva, Joe Hart, and Yaya Toure to comply with Financial Fair Play regulations.
3. Manchester City lost to Manchester United in the derby, leaving their Champions League qualification uncertain.
4. Manchester City is currently in fourth place in the Premier League, just four points ahead of Liverpool, who could overtake them if they win their next match.
5. The top three teams in the Premier League qualify directly for the Champions League, while the fourth-place team must compete in a qualifying round.
6. The total potential bonus for the Manchester City squad for Champions League qualification is around £12 million.
7. Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini has acknowledged the team's poor performance in 2015, including seven losses and early exits from the FA Cup and Champions League.
8. The team's future signings, such as Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba, could be affected by their failure to secure Champions League football, as top players are attracted to clubs participating in the competition.
9. Manchester United, after their victory over City, is confident in attracting top-class players in the upcoming transfer window, according to their manager Louis van Gaal.

The passage summarizes a youth match between Manchester United's and Manchester City's Under 18 teams, referred to as the 'mini-derby.' Manchester United won the match 1-0 with a free-kick goal by Callum Gribbin. The game featured a high number of English players, with 13 out of 22 being English and 10 of those being from Manchester. The match was played at Altrincham's Moss Lane ground with free entry, attracting around 1,000 spectators.

The first half was evenly matched, with Marcus Wood of City and Marcus Rashford of United having the best chances. United's Gribbin, known for his skills, scored the only goal of the game in the second half with a well-placed free-kick. United had opportunities to extend their lead, while City's Javairo Dilrosun nearly equalized with a free-kick that went over the net.

The victory puts United two points behind league leaders Middlesbrough with a game in hand, while City has lost both of their recent matches. The match showcased the talent of young players from both teams, suggesting that they may have promising futures in the senior leagues, despite concerns about the lack of opportunities for young English players.

1. Joe Hart, an English footballer, praised Gianluigi Buffon, calling him a 'legend of the game' after Buffon earned his 147th cap for Italy.
2. Hart himself reached a significant milestone by earning his 50th cap for England during the match against Italy, which ended in a 1-1 draw.
3. Hart expressed his admiration for Buffon, who at 37 years old, continues to excel in his role. Hart, who is 10 years younger, acknowledged that he still has much to learn and looks up to Buffon as an inspiration.
4. The England and Manchester City goalkeeper expressed his desire to continue improving and to accumulate more caps for his country, stating that reaching 50 caps at his age is a significant achievement, but he is not content to stop there.
5. Hart conveyed his pride in representing England and his eagerness to continue contributing to both his club and national team.

Chipotle, a popular Mexican fast-casual chain, has entered the food delivery market by partnering with the Postmates app to offer delivery services in 67 cities. This move is aimed at tapping into the $70 billion food delivery market. Customers placing online or mobile orders through Chipotle will now have the option to have their food delivered, with a service charge of nine per cent added to their bill, in addition to Postmates' delivery fees which start at $5. Chipotle's decision to collaborate with Postmates, which uses independent contractors similar to Uber's model, marks a shift from previously declined offers from third-party delivery services.

The brand's popularity is highlighted by the recent sightings of two presidential candidates at Chipotle locations. Republican candidate Marco Rubio is known to frequent Chipotle and has mentioned tipping the staff, while Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton was seen ordering a chicken burrito bowl with guacamole, a chicken salad, and fruit juice in Maumee, Ohio, just one day after announcing her presidential campaign.

Chipotle is not alone in its venture into delivery services; other major food chains like Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King are also exploring or have already established delivery options, signaling a trend in the industry towards convenience and accessibility for customers.

The parents of Martin Richard, the youngest victim of the Boston Marathon bombings, have publicly appealed for the death penalty to be removed as a sentencing option for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the man convicted of the bombings. Despite Tsarnaev being found guilty on all 30 charges related to the 2013 bombings and the subsequent violent events, Bill and Denise Richard argue that a life sentence without parole and without the possibility of appeal would be a more appropriate punishment. They believe that years of appeals associated with the death penalty would only prolong their family's suffering, reminding them of the painful loss of their son and the severe injuries sustained by their daughter, Jane. The Richards emphasize the personal toll the bombings have taken on their family and express their desire to move forward without the prolonged legal process that a death penalty sentence would entail. They advocate for a resolution that allows for healing and a focus on the future for themselves, the city of Boston, and the nation.

The passage describes the transformation of a Boeing 747 jumbo jet into an opulent private home for an unnamed billionaire. This customized aircraft, which typically seats 600 passengers, has been refitted over three years to cater to the specific tastes of its wealthy owner and can accommodate the owner and dozens of guests. The plane features multiple luxurious areas, including:

- A spacious dining room with an adjoining kitchen for meals prepared by a private chef.
- A lounge and a 'state room' at the rear of the plane.
- An 'aeroloft' on the top deck with eight full beds for sleeping.
- A master bedroom with a large bed, armchair, and sofa.
- A conference room for in-flight meetings.
- An office or guest bedroom with porthole-style windows.
- A main suite with lavish decorations.
- Relaxation areas with sofas for guests to watch television.
- A state room with a desk for work or relaxation.

The interior design resembles that of a luxury hotel rather than a traditional aircraft cabin, and the plane's layout has been published by Greenpoint Technologies. The cost of this extravagant conversion is estimated to be £400 million, making it one of the most luxurious private planes ever built, far surpassing the experience of first-class commercial flights.

1. SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket with an uncrewed Dragon spacecraft from Cape Canaveral, Florida, to the International Space Station (ISS).
2. The primary mission of delivering cargo to the ISS was successful, with Dragon carrying over 4,300 pounds of supplies, including research equipment and an espresso maker called ISSpresso.
3. SpaceX attempted to land the rocket's first stage on a floating barge, which ended in failure. The rocket landed but tipped over, unlike the previous attempt in January when the rocket hit the barge at an angle and exploded.
4. Elon Musk, SpaceX's founder, aims to reduce space travel costs by reusing rockets, comparing it to the reusability of airplanes.
5. The Dragon spacecraft will dock with the ISS, where astronauts will spend about five weeks unloading cargo and then reloading it with experiments, trash, and other items for return to Earth.
6. After undocking, Dragon will splash down in the Pacific Ocean off California.
7. This mission marks SpaceX's sixth mission to the ISS and was initially scheduled for Monday but was postponed due to weather. SpaceX is the first private company to dock with the ISS.

Priscilla Presley, the former wife of Elvis Presley, will be a witness at the inaugural wedding to take place at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas. The chapel is located inside the Westgate Hotel, where Elvis performed over 830 sold-out shows. The wedding is part of a contest organized by NBC's Today show, which offers an Elvis-themed 'ultimate wedding' package to one lucky couple. The winners, to be announced next Monday, will receive a wedding ceremony on April 23, a reception, a two-night hotel suite stay, airfare, and tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show. Priscilla has been involved in the design of the chapel, ensuring it reflects the iconic status of Elvis and is part of a permanent exhibit of his artifacts outside of Graceland in Memphis, Tennessee. She emphasized the seriousness of the chapel, stating there would be no impersonators, and that the venue is a first-class, non-trivial establishment. Couples interested in winning the contest must submit a video or photos with an explanation of why they should be chosen for this unique wedding experience.

1. Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson is optimistic about his team's chances of catching Manchester City in the Premier League standings, despite being four points behind.
2. Henderson and goalkeeper Simon Mignolet have each played 47 games this season, which is the highest number of appearances by any player in the top five European leagues.
3. Liverpool's recent victories, including a 2-0 win against Newcastle United, have reignited their winning form after previous disappointing results against Manchester United and Arsenal.
4. Raheem Sterling scored the opening goal against Newcastle in the ninth minute with a display of fine skill, and Joe Allen scored his first Anfield goal to secure the 2-0 victory after capitalizing on a defensive error.
5. Despite the win, there was controversy as Newcastle had a strong penalty claim denied when Dejan Lovren appeared to foul Ayoze Perez in the area, with Joe Allen admitting it looked like a penalty from his vantage point.
6. The win against Newcastle is crucial for Liverpool as they aim to maintain pressure on Manchester City in the race for the Champions League, with Henderson emphasizing the importance of continuing to win games and perform well until the end of the season.

Roma broke their four-month home winless streak by defeating Napoli 1-0 in a crucial Serie A match for Champions League qualification. The only goal came in the 25th minute when Miralem Pjanic finished a counter-attack. Roma's goalkeeper, Morgan de Sanctis, was instrumental in the victory, making several key saves in the second half. The win provisionally put Roma four points ahead of Lazio in the standings. Napoli's winless run extended to five matches, leaving them in fifth place. The match was played under tight security due to past fan violence, with ticket sales restricted for Napoli supporters and a large police presence. Despite the absence of Roma's captain Francesco Totti and forward Gervinho, Roma secured the victory with Pjanic's early goal. Napoli had a potential penalty claim in the first half, but it was not strongly contested. De Sanctis's outstanding performance, including a notable save from Manolo Gabbiadini, ensured Roma's lead remained intact. Late in the game, Juan Iturbe missed a chance to double the lead, and Napoli's Lorenzo Insigne made a return from injury.

The passage describes a lackluster season for Doncaster Rovers, who are stuck in mid-table in League One. The recent match against Fleetwood Town, which ended in a 0-0 draw, was particularly uneventful, as Fleetwood's play-off hopes had already faded. The match's uneventful nature posed a challenge for Doncaster's media team when compiling highlights, leading them to produce an exceptionally brief 27-second video featuring only 14 seconds of actual match play, including the kickoff, a goal kick, and the final whistle. The video, described as a must-see for football fans, reflects the uninspiring game that tested the patience of even the most dedicated supporters. The passage also mentions the managers' presence on the touchline during the match at the Keepmoat Stadium.

The passage describes the unique relationship between Roland Giroux and his pet blood parrot cichlid, a hybrid fish bred in Taiwan in 1986. Giroux is able to interact with his fish by touching and massaging it, which is unusual for marine pets. The fish demonstrates a remarkable level of comfort and even seems to enjoy the interaction, as it relaxes in Giroux's hand, allows itself to be stroked, and returns to his hand after swimming away. The fish also displays affection by swimming up Giroux's arm and circling his fingers. This interaction developed over time, starting with hand-feeding frozen blood worms, leading to the fish becoming more sociable and eventually enjoying being stroked. Giroux noticed the fish's frustration if it was not played with daily. He would spend at least 15 minutes each day massaging and playing with the fish. Initially, the cichlid shared its tank with two other fish, but they were removed due to bullying. The video of their interaction shows the fish's trust and bond with Giroux, as it buries its face in his hand and follows his hand to the surface of the water when he removes it from the tank.

1. Ben Stokes has a reputation for being a fiery, aggressive player in the England cricket team.
2. He previously broke his wrist punching a locker at the Kensington Oval, highlighting his need to channel his aggression constructively.
3. Stokes' character is appreciated for bringing excitement to the game, contrasting with the perception of players as 'robots'.
4. After a clash with Marlon Samuels during a Test match, Stokes responded positively following a conversation with England coach Peter Moores.
5. Stokes' aggression, such as standing up to Mitchell Johnson during the Ashes, is valued, but it requires careful management to ensure it benefits his performance.
6. There is a balance to be struck in allowing Stokes' natural exuberance while ensuring it does not lead to consistent lows in performance.
7. Stokes should avoid trying to live up to his reputation in a way that could pigeonhole him, and his aggression should be a natural part of his game as long as it contributes to his performance in terms of runs and wickets.
8. England's team management wants Stokes to play as often as possible to help him reach his full potential.
9. There is a consideration for team selection, with the possibility of playing a second spinner, which could affect Stokes' or Chris Jordan's place in the team. However, England is keen to have both Stokes and Jordan play frequently to develop their international careers.
10. The upcoming summer is expected to require fewer spinners, making it an opportune time for Stokes and Jordan to establish themselves in the team.

1. The Euro 2016 qualifier between Wales and Belgium on June 12 at the Cardiff City Stadium has sold out all 33,000 tickets.
2. Wales and Belgium are the top two teams in Group B, both with 11 points from five games, with Belgium leading on goal difference due to their fourth place in the world rankings.
3. Wales' recent 3-0 win over Israel, including a brilliant free-kick by Gareth Bale, has boosted their chances of qualifying for a major tournament for the first time since the 1958 World Cup.
4. The Football Association of Wales reported a surge in ticket demand after the victory over Israel, leading to the sell-out.
5. Despite speculation, the match will not be moved to the larger Millennium Stadium due to UEFA rules, which also aligns with the preference of the Wales squad to play at the Cardiff City Stadium for its more intimate atmosphere.

1. England's Under-17 football team, the defending champions, will compete in the UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria in May, led by coach John Peacock.
2. The team qualified with a perfect record and has been drawn into Group D with Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland.
3. Their first match is against Italy on May 7 in Burgas.
4. The squad includes players from various Premier League clubs, with notable inclusions being Chelsea's Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo, Arsenal's Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi (first call-up), and Liverpool's Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold (recalled after missing the Elite Round of qualifiers).
5. The remaining group matches are against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13.
6. The goalkeepers in the squad are Paul Woolston from Newcastle United and Will Huffer from Leeds United.
7. Other players in the squad include defenders Danny Collinge, Reece Oxford, Easah Suliman, James Yates, and Tayo Edun; midfielders Daniel Wright, Tom Davies, Marcus Edwards, and Nathan Holland; and forward Layton Ndukwu.

Manchester City is actively seeking to recruit Anderlecht's 14-year-old prodigy, Evangelos Patoulidis, who is highly regarded within the club's youth system. Despite interest from other top clubs like Arsenal and Barcelona, the young playmaker previously turned down an offer from Barcelona's La Masia academy at age 12 to focus on his studies. Patoulidis has continued to showcase his talent, prompting Manchester City to engage in talks with Anderlecht's chairman, Roger Vanden Stock, to negotiate a compensation deal. Manchester City's manager, Manuel Pellegrini, aims to secure the promising talent as part of his strategy to build the team's future.

1. Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old transgender escort from Mexico, was found dead in a flat in Fulham, London, at the end of March.
2. Her body showed signs of strangulation and beating, with injuries to the head and neck being the cause of death.
3. A 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with her death but was later released on bail and instructed to return for further police questioning.
4. Scotland Yard has appealed to the public for information, especially from those who may have been in contact with Santillan before her death.
5. Santillan worked as an escort in London, Paris, and Miami, as advertised on her website.
6. The London Ambulance Service was called to the scene on March 28th, around 9:30 pm, where Santillan was pronounced dead.
7. Detective Chief Inspector Rebecca Reeves is leading the investigation and has urged anyone with information about Santillan's activities on the Friday and Saturday before her death to come forward to help determine the motive behind the killing.
8. Santillan had expressed her affection for London and Paris on social media and her website, where she described herself as visiting from Miami and seeking 'upscale' gentlemen.

1. Dawn, a woman who has suffered seven miscarriages, appeared on The Jeremy Kyle show to confront her family friend and house-mate, Jamie, about stealing money she had saved for her deceased baby's gravestone.
2. The money stolen amounted to £207, which was part of the £500 needed for the gravestone of Dawn's baby, Daniel James.
3. Initially, Jamie and his girlfriend Carol denied taking the money, but a lie detector test administered by Jeremy Kyle revealed that Jamie was lying and had indeed stolen the funds.
4. Prior to the lie detector results, Jamie had sent Dawn a Facebook message confessing to taking the money but claimed his girlfriend Carol was to blame.
5. Dawn expressed her deep distress and sense of betrayal over the theft, as she had been saving to honor her son with a proper headstone to show her love for him.
6. The emotional confrontation on the show led to Dawn breaking down in tears and leaving the stage, with the incident being filmed by the show's cameras.
7. Dawn's partner, also named Jamie, comforted her following the revelation and her emotional response on the show.

200-228 Yazidis, primarily women, children, the ill, and the elderly, were released by ISIS in northern Iraq. The release was coordinated with the help of Arab tribal leaders and received by the Peshmerga, who then sent them to Irbil, the Kurdish regional capital. The exact reason for the release was unclear. This event follows previous releases of Yazidis by ISIS since their initial attack on Yazidi towns last year. The Yazidis, a minority group of Kurdish descent with a unique syncretic religion, have faced extreme persecution by ISIS, including killings, rape, and enslavement, leading to a significant humanitarian crisis. The international community has responded with humanitarian aid, rescue operations, and airstrikes against ISIS in Iraq and Syria. The Yazidi population in northern Iraq is estimated at 500,000, making up less than 1% of the country's population.

Harry Kane, a rising star for Tottenham and the English national team, has had a remarkable season, earning him nominations for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Season awards. His on-pitch enthusiasm is well-documented through his goal celebrations, and now his achievements are celebrated in a new animation by Copa90. This video showcases some of Kane's best goals and celebrations, including his 20th Premier League goal against Newcastle, a long-range strike against Chelsea, a headed goal against Arsenal, and his scoring debut for England. The animation, which creates an animated effect using still photographs, is titled "Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?" and has been released in anticipation of the PFA awards ceremony, where Kane is competing for the top honor against other notable players like Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez.

Jamie Carragher, a former Liverpool defender, has expressed his support for Brendan Rodgers to continue as Liverpool's manager despite a season without trophies and a probable failure to finish in the top four. Carragher believes that Rodgers' future should not be judged solely on the current season's outcomes. He acknowledges the difficulty of integrating new players and remains optimistic about the team's potential to improve, win a trophy, and secure a top-four finish next season. Carragher emphasizes the importance of making the right signings to enhance the squad.

Additionally, Carragher has been recognized for his community work on Merseyside with a Beacon Award. Through his 23 Foundation, he has been involved in coaching in deprived areas of Merseyside, aiming to inspire youngsters and give back to the community he grew up in. He hopes his efforts will provide support and encouragement to local youth, reflecting the close-knit nature of the Liverpool community.

James Hayward, a four-year-old boy, had his toy nerf gun confiscated by security at East Midlands Airport as it was considered a security risk. While traveling with his parents to Lanzarote, James's toy, which fires sponge darts, was detected by the X-ray machine. Security staff insisted that James surrender the toy and subjected him to a thorough frisking, a response his father, Phil, described as 'ludicrous' and 'over-zealous.' The incident caused the family to be late for their flight, and they chose not to argue in order to catch their plane. Upon returning from their holiday, James was bought a replacement toy gun. East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience and offered to post the original toy back to their home in Doncaster. The airport defended its actions by stating that the safety and security of passengers are the top priority, and that government regulations prohibit any items that resemble prohibited articles, including replica or model guns, from passing through security.

A man from Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, has posted an advertisement on Gumtree in search of a girlfriend or wife. The man, known only as Rich and aged 31, has provided a detailed description of his ideal partner and himself. He desires someone who loves pets, is a non-drinker and non-smoker, fit, attractive, reliable, honest, loyal, good around the house, handy, a good cook, and excellent in bed. Rich offers potential benefits such as accommodation, a company car, phone, laptop, free gym membership, and promises to be generous with his wealth. He describes himself as athletic, white, heavily tattooed, with brown hair and eyes, and enjoys traveling, the outdoors, sports, and is drug-free. Rich is 175cm tall, well-endowed, owns property, is financially successful, and has a love for cars and bikes. He emphasizes that he is not shy about spending money on his partner. The advertisement also states that the ideal candidate should be both outdoorsy and able to be a princess when necessary. Rich has indicated that former partners should not apply, and he is open to considering all reasonable offers. An attempt by Daily Mail Australia to contact him was unsuccessful.

Greg Dyke, the Football Association chairman, is advocating for significant changes in English football, including increasing the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12 and redefining 'home-grown' to mean training in England before the age of 18 instead of 21. His proposals face opposition from the Premier League.

Five former England managers—Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson, and Steve McClaren—have publicly supported Dyke's reforms in a letter, as reported by the Daily Telegraph. They argue that the English game will suffer if these changes are not implemented, potentially harming England's chances of winning the World Cup.

The letter emphasizes the urgency of the situation, pointing out that only 36.8% of Premier League starters in the last round of matches were eligible for England selection. The former managers acknowledge that there are multiple reasons for England's lack of success since 1966 but highlight the shrinking pool of English talent in top-level football as a significant issue.

Despite these concerns, there is optimism due to the emergence of young talents like Ross Barkley, Raheem Sterling, and Harry Kane. However, the managers stress that these players need more opportunities to play at the highest level to fulfill their potential. The letter calls for unity in the English game to support the FA's England Commission's proposals to improve the national team's fortunes.

1. Demelza Poldark, portrayed by Eleanor Tomlinson, has become a mother to a baby daughter in the TV show "Poldark."
2. In the upcoming episode, viewers will see Ross Poldark, played by Aidan Turner, looking adoringly at his newborn child.
3. Ross Poldark, a character who has captured the hearts of many viewers, is perceived as unavailable as he appears to be deeply committed to his family.
4. The show has faced criticism for its portrayal of pregnancy timelines, with Demelza seemingly progressing from an early stage of pregnancy to giving birth within a very short timeframe, which some fans have noted and joked about on social media.
5. The pregnancy timeline issue is not new to the show; a previous pregnancy storyline with Elizabeth, another character with ties to Ross, also experienced a rapid full-term progression between episodes.
6. The accelerated pregnancy storylines have been a topic of humor among viewers, with one fan commenting on the unrealistic time jump on Twitter.

Leicester City manager Nigel Pearson has called on his team to concentrate on their own performances and disregard the results of other teams in the relegation battle. Despite being at the bottom of the Barclays Premier League, Leicester has boosted their chances of avoiding relegation with consecutive wins, including a crucial 3-2 victory against West Brom, where Jamie Vardy scored a last-minute goal. Although they are still three points away from safety, Pearson emphasizes that Leicester's fate is in their own hands. He cautions against over-optimism and stresses the importance of focusing on their remaining matches to ensure they have a realistic chance of survival in the Premier League. Pearson acknowledges that other teams are also at risk of relegation, but insists that Leicester must not be distracted by external factors and should remain dedicated to their own game plan.

1. A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara has set a new record for the longest migration of a mammal, traveling nearly 14,000 miles (22,500 kilometers).
2. The study involving Varvara was conducted with the help of scientists from Oregon State University.
3. Varvara's journey began at her primary feeding ground off Russia's Sakhalin Island and ended in Baja, Mexico, after crossing the Pacific Ocean and traveling down the West Coast of the United States.
4. This migration surpassed the previous record held by a humpback whale that traveled a round trip of 10,190 miles between warm breeding waters and colder feeding areas.
5. Lead author Bruce Mate suggests that Varvara's extensive travel, which included visits to three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales, indicates that she may originally be from Mexico, challenging previous assumptions about her being an endangered western whale.
6. The findings raise questions about the genetic differentiation between eastern and western gray whales and imply that some western gray whales might actually be eastern grays, which is significant given the critically low population of western gray whales, estimated at around 150 individuals.
7. The study suggests a need for a closer look at the genetic distinction between the two species of gray whales.

1,000 feet of seabed near the Shiretoko Peninsula on Japan's Hokkaido Island has risen above sea level, reaching up to 50 feet in height and stretching 1,000 to 1,640 feet in length and 100 feet in width. This sudden emergence of land, which occurred without any noticeable tremors or sounds, is believed to have been caused by a landslide triggered by melting ice and snow, which in turn caused a section of land to drop and pivot the underwater area into the air. The new coastline, which includes marine organisms still attached to it, surprised local residents and authorities alike. Geologists have conducted an aerial survey to assess the situation, and while they do not expect the landmass to expand further, they have not determined the exact timing of the landslide. The event is not linked to the 7.8 magnitude earthquake that occurred in the Kathmandu Valley on the previous Saturday.

Gregory van der Wiel has refuted rumors suggesting he will leave Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) in the summer, expressing his affection for the club. Despite a disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc, which led to him being dropped for a Champions League match against Chelsea, Van der Wiel remains content in Paris. He has stated his desire to stay with PSG, citing his happiness with the club, the city, and his teammates. Van der Wiel is eager to sign a new contract and is prepared to play whenever selected by the coach. However, PSG's interest in Barcelona's Dani Alves raises questions about Van der Wiel's future at the club, as the potential signing could influence whether he stays or is sold.

Carlos Tevez, the top scorer in Serie A with 17 goals, has expressed his desire to leave Juventus at the end of the current season, despite his contract running until the end of next season. The 31-year-old striker, who has won two Serie A titles with Juventus and is on course for a third, wishes to return to his boyhood club Boca Juniors in Argentina. Boca Juniors' president, Daniel Angelici, has confirmed that they are close to finalizing a deal for Tevez, but it is contingent upon Tevez terminating his contract with Juventus. Although Juventus is reluctant to lose Tevez, they have acknowledged his desire to leave and are already scouting for potential replacements. Tevez's international manager, Tata Martino, has stated that Tevez's decision to move will not affect his standing in the Argentina national team, emphasizing that playing for Boca Juniors would not be a step down from Juventus.

1. Bayern Munich, managed by Pep Guardiola, defeated Porto 6-1 in the Champions League quarter-final second leg at the Allianz Arena.
2. Bayern led 5-0 at half-time, overturning Porto's 3-1 lead from the first leg.
3. Goals were scored by Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso, and Robert Lewandowski netted twice.
4. During the match, Pep Guardiola tore a hole in his left trouser leg, exposing his underwear, and joked about needing new trousers for the next match.
5. Bayern's dominant performance secured their place in the Champions League semi-finals.
6. Guardiola, the former Barcelona boss, also removed his suit blazer as the match progressed.
7. The victory demonstrated Bayern's strength, leaving their European rivals potentially fearful of facing them.

A multi-vehicle crash occurred on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale, involving ten individuals, including four children. Two rescue helicopters airlifted four of the injured to the Princess Alexandra Hospital: a 40-year-old man with chest and shoulder injuries, a five-year-old boy with chest pain, a 27-year-old woman with arm injuries, and a six-year-old girl with abdominal pain. Six others, including an infant and two young girls, were transported to Ipswich Hospital for minor injuries or further assessment. A man sustained hand lacerations, and two females were uninjured. The highway was closed with diversions in place following the accident, and emergency crews extracted one trapped person using hydraulic cutting gear. The Rescue 500 helicopter was involved in the patient transport. Police reported that the highway would remain closed for several hours.

1. Arsenal, second in the Premier League, will host leaders Chelsea in a crucial match on Sunday.
2. Arsenal's star midfielder Mesut Ozil, excited for the upcoming game, received a new Apple Watch, which he showed off on Instagram, comparing it to the gadget used by the character Michael Knight in the TV show Knight Rider.
3. Ozil has been a significant contributor to Arsenal's season with four goals in 25 matches and is expected to play in the weekend's fixture.
4. Arsenal is currently 10 points behind Chelsea with six league games left in the season.
5. The team has been bolstered by the return of Jack Wilshere, who recovered from a five-month injury layoff and was on the bench for Arsenal's FA Cup semi-final win over Reading.
6. Former Arsenal player Ray Parlour expressed his belief in Wilshere's potential, stating that if Wilshere can stay fit, he could be a key player for the club, drawing a parallel with the injury-plagued career of Abou Diaby as a cautionary tale.

1. Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby between Manchester United and Manchester City at Old Trafford.
2. Clattenburg has previously sent off three players from both United and City this season, including City's Vincent Kompany during Belgium's Euro 2016 qualifier against Israel, which resulted in Kompany's suspension for the match against Wales.
3. In the Premier League this season, Clattenburg has sent off two Manchester United players: Tyler Blackett against Leicester and Luke Shaw against West Ham.
4. Despite past controversies, Clattenburg is considered one of the Premier League's top referees, along with Michael Oliver.
5. The derby is significant as it could influence which team finishes second in the league behind Chelsea.
6. Manchester United are on a high after five consecutive league wins, while Manchester City have struggled since the new year.
7. Clattenburg will be assisted by Simon Beck and Jake Collin, with Jonathan Moss as the fourth official.
8. Clattenburg's record of only two red cards in the season, both given to United players, is noted in the context of the upcoming derby.
